Class GameScreen

java.lang.Object
com.shiroyama.chess2.screens.GameScreen
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
public class GameScreen extends Object implements com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
Represents the Screen where the normal chess game takes place. Handles AttackListener, PromotionListener, rendering, updating the game state. Manages UI elements, such as promotion button, transition to arena screen when an attack occurs.

  • Method Details

    • show

      public void show()
      Called when this screen becomes the current screen for the game. This method is part of the Screen interface and is invoked by the LibGDX framework when the screen is displayed.
      Specified by:
      show in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen

      Renders the chess board, game state and pieces.
      Specified by:

      Parameters:

    • exitArena

      public void exitArena(PieceInfo winner, PieceInfo loser)
      Handles the transition back from the ArenaScreen. This method is called when the combat between the two pieces end.
      Parameters:
      winner - the piece that won the combat
      loser - the piece that lost the combat
